body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Gov Ky

Your petitioner Samuel Mapin a citisen of Taylor county Ky States that at the Sept Term ^1863^ of the Taylor Circuit Court he was presented to the Grand Jury within and for the body of Said County and that Said Grand Jury found an Indictment against him charging him with assaulting & Beating one William Blackey He further State that at the March Term of Said Court he was tried by a Jury and fined fifty dollars upon Said Indictment He Stats the facts in the case to be these: That in a lively Jovial & Spirited conversation with Said Blackey he placed his hand upon Said Blacky and pushed him but that he had no evil design whatever in So doing that he had no intention at the time of committing an assault and entertained no ill will towards the prosecuting witness. that he & Said Blaky took oysters togethr immediately aftr the occurance and that these are all the facts in the case.

He Therefore believes Said fine to believe be wholy unjust Wherefore he prays that your excellency will remit Said fine in accordance with the powr in you vested by the Statutes of this commonwealth in Such cases made & provided.
State of Ky Court of Taylor
Samuel Mapin States that the facts contained in the forgoing petition are true
Subscribed & Sworn to before me by Samuel Mupin this 28th March 1864
Wm Dearen J. P. T. C

We the undersigned citisens of Taylor county Ky are acquainted with your petitioner Samuel
Mapin and believe him entitiled to when on oath and would therefore present him to the favourable consideration of your Excellency.

J H Chandler Rep
R G Jeter D. M. T. C
J. B. McWhorter Sheriff

Taylor Co
64
Refused
Tho E Bramlette
